alert.note: Alert for Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264 (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 13 at 11:14AM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Navajo County near Joseph City through 1245 PM MDT... At 1213 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Joseph City, or 23 miles east of Winslow, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, nickel size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Localized flooding is possible. Locations impacted include... Holbrook and Joseph City. This includes the following highways... Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 289. Interstate 40 between mile markers 272 and 294. State Route 77 between mile markers 388 and 399. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264
